rank.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc
rank.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He was sentenced to prison and stripped of his rank  (=had his rank taken from him).
During the war Harold had risen to the rank of major.
rise to/be promoted to/attain the rank of something
officers below the rank of Colonel
He held  (=had) the  rank of Chief Inspector.
rank.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a rank of people or things is a line or row of them
rank.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Everyone lines up in ranks, all facing the instructor.
On the shelves were rank after rank of liquor bottles.
Silently, ranks of police edged closer to the crowds.
rank.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the degree to which something or someone is of high quality
rank.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: While none of these pictures is of the first rank  (=of the highest quality), some are of interest.
rank.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: people of all ranks in society
He came from a family of rank  (=one from a high social class).
rank.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a place where taxis wait in a line to be hired
rank.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: I called a taxi from the rank outside.
rank.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: From 1 Dec 1914 to 31 Oct 1915 he held the rank of captain.
He rose to the rank of colonel.
He was promoted to the rank of Captain.
The officer was stripped of his rank for his part in affair.
Her father had been an army officer of fairly high rank.
He held a junior rank in the infantry.
As promised, a minister of cabinet rank has now been appointed to supervise its operation
rank.translation[1].definitions[0].type: intransitive always + adverb/preposition, not in progressive
rank.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance
rank.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He ranked high among the pioneers of 20th century chemical technology.
Today’s match ranks as one of the most exciting games that these two have ever played.
We rank among the safest countries in the world.
Cuvier wanted to turn natural history into a science that would rank with physics and chemistry.
rank.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to decide the position of someone or something on a list based on quality or importance
rank.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: It is not always easy to rank the students in order of ability.
Agassi was at that time ranked sixth in the world.
rank.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to have a higher rank than someone else
rank.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to arrange objects in a line or row
rank.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: There were several pairs of riding boots ranked neatly in the hall.
rank.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if something is rank, it has a very strong unpleasant smell
rank.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: the rank odour of sweat and urine
rank.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: used to emphasize a bad or undesirable quality
rank.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: an example of this government’s rank stupidity
They make us look like rank amateurs  (=not at all good or professional).
rank.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: rank plants are too thick and have spread everywhere
rank.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a particular level of job in an organization, especially a government organization or the army
rank.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: His father retired with the rank of major.
Knight-Ridder named Maxwell King, 46, to succeed Mr. Roberts, but at a lower rank.
The companies have been trying to reduce the number of management ranks in a bid to be more cost-efficient.
rank.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: a particular position in a list that has been put in order of quality or importance
rank.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: No US airline broke the top 10 rank (=no US airline was higher than 10th) in an airline survey released yesterday.
rank.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: to have a particular position in a list that has been put in order of quality or importance
rank.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: It ranks in the top 3% of all mutual funds.
rank.translation[4].definitions[1].defin: to decide the position of something or someone in a list in order of quality or importance
rank.translation[4].definitions[1].examp: The firm was ranked the number five underwriter of US bond and stock issues.
The real estate executives ranked the Northeast as the least attractive area for development.
